topics.name: Basic Greetings
topics.description: Learn how to greet people in English

topics.name: Daily Routines
topics.description: Vocabulary and grammar for talking about daily activities

topics.name: Food & Dining
topics.description: Learn vocabulary related to food, restaurants, and cooking

topics.name: Travel & Transportation
topics.description: Essential English for traveling and using transportation

lessons.title: Hello and Goodbye
lessons.description: Common greetings and farewells in English

content.introduction: Learn the most common ways to greet people and say goodbye in English.

lessons.title: Introducing Yourself
lessons.description: How to introduce yourself to others

content.introduction: Learn how to tell people your name and where you're from.
Essential verbs to describe your daily activities.

content.text: I wake up at 7 AM every day. I get up and have breakfast with my family. Then I go to work at 8:30 AM. I work until 5 PM. After work, I come home and have dinner. I usually go to bed at 10 PM.

content.introduction: Learn the names of common foods.

content.text: The most common greeting in English is 'Hello'. You can use it in any situation.
When leaving, you can say 'Goodbye', 'Bye', or 'See you later'.
To introduce yourself, say 'My name is...' or 'I'm...'
What do you do in the morning?
Learn the names of healthy foods.

content.question: Which word is a formal greeting?

questions.explanation: 'Hello' can be used in both formal and informal situations.
Hi, Hey, and What's up are all informal greetings.

content.question: 'Goodbye' is only used in formal situations.
content.statement: 'Goodbye' is only used in formal situations.

questions.explanation: 'Goodbye' can be used in both formal and informal situations, though 'Bye' is more common informally.
We use 'is' after 'My name' to complete the sentence.

content.question: Match the activities with the time of day:

questions.explanation: These activities typically happen at these times of day.

content.question: Which of these is a fruit?

questions.explanation: An apple is a fruit. The others are vegetables.

definition.meaning: Used as a greeting or to begin a phone conversation
Used to express good wishes when parting or at the end of a conversation
The first meal of the day, usually eaten in the morning
definition.example: I have breakfast at 7 AM every day.

definition.meaning: A round fruit with red, green, or yellow skin and white flesh
definition.example: I eat an apple every day.

definition.meaning: Pleasing to the senses or mind aesthetically

content.title: My First Week Learning English
content.body: Hi everyone! I just completed my first week of learning English. I learned so many new words about greetings and daily routines. The lessons are really helpful. Does anyone have tips for improving pronunciation?

content.title: Favorite Food Vocabulary
content.body: I love the food vocabulary lesson! I can now order food in English at restaurants. My favorite new word is 'delicious'. What are your favorite food-related words?

content.title: Question About Greetings
content.body: When should I use 'Good morning' vs 'Hello'? Is there a specific time when 'Good morning' is more appropriate?

daily_missions.description: Complete a section with 80% or higher score
Save 3 new words to your vocabulary
